How was the nanobody RBD-1-2G engineered: By creating bivalent and trivalent formats
By incorporating additional mutations in the CDRs
What challenge does the nanobody RBD-1-2: Reduced binding against variants with mutations at E484
Increased off-target binding in human cells
Inability to bind the spike protein in the 'down' conformation
What is the primary function of the SARS: Facilitating viral entry by binding to the host cell receptor ACE2
Assembling new viral particles within the host cell
What is the significance of the nanobody: It overlaps with the ACE2 binding site, enhancing neutralization
It prevents the spike protein from undergoing conformational changes
It allows the nanobody to bind to multiple viral proteins
It increases the nanobody's stability in different environmental conditions
